alert.note: Alert for Benton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 08 at 6:47PM CDT until May 08 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, and south central Missouri, including the following counties, in central Missouri, Benton, Camden, Hickory, Maries, Miller, Morgan and Pulaski. In east central Missouri, Phelps. In south central Missouri, Dent. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 647 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Crooked Creek at Highway TT, Wet Glaize at Carrol Cave Road, Norman Creek at County Road 4220, Meramec River at Spur Road, Dry Auglaize Creek at Freedom Ridge Road, Rainy Creek at Knobby Road and Atwell Creek at Highway K. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rolla, Osage Beach, Camdenton, St. Robert, Village of Four Seasons, Lake Ozark, Dixon, Crocker, Laurie, Iberia, Doolittle, Newburg, Sunrise Beach, Linn Creek, Climax Springs, Brumley, Lakeside, Devil`s Elbow, Jerome, Swedeborg, Northwye, Lecoma, Montreal, Freedom, Kaiser, Lake Spring, Old Linn Creek, Green Bay Terrace, Bangert, Howes, Hurricane Deck, Purvis, Sligo, Barnumton, Stone Hill, Howes Mill, Boss, Lake of The Ozarks and Lake of The Ozarks State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
